content.description: Sit start down low on the obvious sloper edge on the front of the Railyard boulder (facing the railroad tracks and 103). Work left on the sloper edge and then cross right hand into bad crimps. From there, grab a left-hand edge by the arete. Slap your right hand up to the sloper rail higher up, and then top out on decent holds with good feet.
content.location: Sit starts on the lower right-hand side of the front face of the Railyard boulder, traverses left to the arete, and then goes straight up the tallest point.

content.description: Stand start low on the left-hand arete of the front face of the Railyard boulder. Work the arete straight up to the top.
content.location: Stand starts on the left-hand arete of the front face of the Railyard boulder.

content.description: A spread out area with a couple of blocks along VT Rt. 103 between Ludlow and Rutland. Only a couple of the boulders are worthwhile. The Railyard hosts several stellar lines, some possibly worthy of five stars.
